intro: Protorhus ditimena var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed protorhus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or white, and it serves as a food source for various insects and small animals.
